title: Grabbitz Finds Beauty in Chaos With Triumphant New Album, "Big Epic Nothing"
description: Blending raw emotion with electrifying production, Grabbitz delivers a deeply personal and genre-defying journey in "Big Epic Nothing."
author: Harrison Goldstein
excerpt: Blending raw emotion with electrifying production, Grabbitz delivers a deeply personal and genre-defying journey in "Big Epic Nothing."
siteName: EDM.com - The Latest Electronic Dance Music News, Reviews & Artists
text: Blending raw emotion with electrifying production, Grabbitz delivers a deeply personal and genre-defying journey in "Big Epic Nothing."Blending raw emotion with electrifying production, Grabbitz delivers a deeply personal and genre-defying journey in "Big Epic Nothing."HomeMUSIC RELEASESGrabbitz has released a new album, Big Epic Nothing, unearthing raw emotion across 11 tracks and painting an intimate portrait of an artist who has never been afraid to embrace vulnerability. Grabbitz has never been one to conform. The genre-blending singer-songwriter, producer and multi-instrumentalist has long occupied a lane of his own, bridging electronic music with rock and consistently pushing boundaries in the process. With Big Epic Nothing, his fifth studio album and first full-length release under his own Blue Butterfly Records imprint, he reinforces his standing as one of today's most compelling voices in dance music.A deeply personal project, the album arrives as Grabbitz supports fellow rocktronic producer Sullivan King on his "Chaos Will Bring Peace" tour, a fitting backdrop for a record that revels in explosive energy and cathartic storytelling."This album is a reflection of everything I’ve been through—musically and personally," Grabbitz said in a press release. "It's my story of finding beauty in chaos and creating meaning from emptiness."Scroll to ContinueRecommended ArticlesFrom the very first moments of Big Epic Nothing, we are thrust into its tempestuous storm of emotion and sound. Its opener, "Hero Pt. II," sets the stage with haunting lyricism before erupting into a thunderous drop. While its melancholic beginnings may suggest despair, the song ultimately builds into a triumphant anthem, underscoring the resilience at the heart of the album. "This is not a story where the hero dies at the end," Grabbitz declares, establishing a defiant tone.While the album largely stands as a solo endeavor, its sole collaboration, "Love You 'Til I'm Dead," commands attention. Released fittingly as a single on Valentine’s Day, the track merges Rezz's signature eerie basslines with Grabbitz’s cinematic vocal delivery, crafting a dark yet oddly romantic experience.As Big Epic Nothing unfolds, its versatility becomes even more apparent. "And I Run And I Run" shifts into full-throttle rock territory, featuring anthemic guitar riffs and a vocal performance that oscillates between soaring melodies and a rap-like cadence. Elsewhere, "Gasping For Air" straddles the line between spellbinding electronica and introspective alt-rock, with distorted synths  masterfully melting into the hypnotic pull of the track's aching vocals.More than just another chapter in Grabbitz’s evolution, Big Epic Nothing is a testament to his artistic fearlessness. By refusing to be confined by genre, he continues to carve out his own path, bound neither by the constraints of expectations nor talent. html:
Blending raw emotion with electrifying production, Grabbitz delivers a deeply personal and genre-defying journey in "Big Epic Nothing."

Blending raw emotion with electrifying production, Grabbitz delivers a deeply personal and genre-defying journey in "Big Epic Nothing."

  • Home
  • MUSIC RELEASES

Grabbitz has released a new album, Big Epic Nothing, unearthing raw emotion across 11 tracks and painting an intimate portrait of an artist who has never been afraid to embrace vulnerability. 

Grabbitz has never been one to conform. The genre-blending singer-songwriter, producer and multi-instrumentalist has long occupied a lane of his own, bridging electronic music with rock and consistently pushing boundaries in the process. With Big Epic Nothing, his fifth studio album and first full-length release under his own Blue Butterfly Records imprint, he reinforces his standing as one of today's most compelling voices in dance music.

A deeply personal project, the album arrives as Grabbitz supports fellow rocktronic producer Sullivan King on his "Chaos Will Bring Peace" tour, a fitting backdrop for a record that revels in explosive energy and cathartic storytelling.

"This album is a reflection of everything I’ve been through—musically and personally," Grabbitz said in a press release. "It's my story of finding beauty in chaos and creating meaning from emptiness."

Scroll to Continue

Recommended Articles

From the very first moments of Big Epic Nothing, we are thrust into its tempestuous storm of emotion and sound. Its opener, "Hero Pt. II," sets the stage with haunting lyricism before erupting into a thunderous drop. While its melancholic beginnings may suggest despair, the song ultimately builds into a triumphant anthem, underscoring the resilience at the heart of the album. "This is not a story where the hero dies at the end," Grabbitz declares, establishing a defiant tone.

While the album largely stands as a solo endeavor, its sole collaboration, "Love You 'Til I'm Dead," commands attention. Released fittingly as a single on Valentine’s Day, the track merges Rezz's signature eerie basslines with Grabbitz’s cinematic vocal delivery, crafting a dark yet oddly romantic experience.

As Big Epic Nothing unfolds, its versatility becomes even more apparent. "And I Run And I Run" shifts into full-throttle rock territory, featuring anthemic guitar riffs and a vocal performance that oscillates between soaring melodies and a rap-like cadence. Elsewhere, "Gasping For Air" straddles the line between spellbinding electronica and introspective alt-rock, with distorted synths  masterfully melting into the hypnotic pull of the track's aching vocals.

More than just another chapter in Grabbitz’s evolution, Big Epic Nothing is a testament to his artistic fearlessness. By refusing to be confined by genre, he continues to carve out his own path, bound neither by the constraints of expectations nor talent.

Listen to Big Epic Nothing below and find the new album on streaming platforms here.
